intro: Hieracium jebei, commonly known as the Siberian hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to the cold regions of Siberia and northern Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers, and it blooms from late summer to early autumn. Hieracium jebei is adapted to harsh climates and is often found in meadows, tundra, and rocky areas.
